subject: Music
title: Tori Amos: Confessional Piano
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Tori Amos: Confessional Piano.

hook.text: Tori Amos played piano so intensely that she seemed to be wrestling with the instrument itself.

buildup.text: She enrolled at the Peabody Conservatory at age five â€” the youngest student ever admitted.

discovery.text: Little Earthquakes in 1992 redefined confessional songwriting with raw honesty about trauma.

twist.text: She founded RAINN â€” the largest anti-sexual-assault organization in America â€” using her platform.

climax.text: She proved that vulnerability on stage is its own kind of power.

punchline.text: She played her pain out loud. Millions felt less alone.
